intro: Pinus orizabensis, commonly known as the Orizaba pine, is a species of evergreen conifer native to Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and needle-like leaves that grow in clusters of five. The tree produces cones that are typically reddish-brown and contain seeds surrounded by a papery wing. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. This species plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitat, providing habitat for various wildlife species.
